answerText: "The Children's Hour"[10] Longfellow, the author of "The Children's Hour," also wrote this poem about an Acadian girl who is in love with Gabriel Lajeunesse.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 11 | 9 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This poem ends with the narrator telling his daughters that he will put them "down into the dungeon / In the rount-tower of [his] heart." For 10 points each: [10] Name this poem about "Grave Alice, and laughing Allegra, / And Edith with golden hair."
